tables.table_schema: CREATE TABLE recipes (recipe_id INT PRIMARY KEY, recipe_name VARCHAR(255), instructions TEXT);
CREATE TABLE ingredients (ingredient_id INT PRIMARY KEY, ingredient_name VARCHAR(255), quantity VARCHAR(50), recipe_id INT, FOREIGN KEY (recipe_id) REFERENCES recipes(recipe_id));
CREATE TABLE cooking_instructions (instruction_id INT PRIMARY KEY, step_order INT, description TEXT, recipe_id INT, FOREIGN KEY (recipe_id) REFERENCES recipes(recipe_id));

CREATE TABLE recipes (
    recipe_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    recipe_name VARCHAR(255),
    recipe_category VARCHAR(100),
    recipe_description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE ingredients (
    ingredient_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    ingredient_name VARCHAR(100),
    ingredient_category VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE recipe_ingredients (
    recipe_id INT,
    ingredient_id INT,
    quantity INT,
    unit VARCHAR(50)
    PRIMARY KEY (recipe_id, ingredient_id)
)

CREATE TABLE instructions (
    recipe_id INT,
    step_number INT,
    instruction TEXT,
    PRIMARY KEY (recipe_id, step_number)
)

CREATE TABLE ingredients (
 id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
 quantity VARCHAR(50),
 recipe_id INT,
 FOREIGN KEY (recipe_id) REFERENCES recipes(id)
);

CREATE TABLE instructions (
 id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 step_number INT,
 description TEXT,
 recipe_id INT,
 FOREIGN KEY (recipe_id) REFERENCES recipes(id)
);

CREATE TABLE recipe_cookware (
 recipe_id INT,
 cookware_id INT,
 PRIMARY KEY (recipe_id, cookware_id),
 FOREIGN KEY (recipe_id) REFERENCES recipes(id),
 FOREIGN KEY (cookware_id) REFERENCES cookware(id)
);
